intro: Antirhea minutifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved antirhea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
